ANGLE ON: TINTIN, SNOWY and HADDOCK are RIDING CAMELS. As crest a SAND DUNE, BAGGHAR is revealed below them. The KARABOUDJAN is heading into PORT. TINTIN points to the KARABOUDJAN.
He's here.

ANGLES ON: Rushing through the narrow streets of BAGGHAR, TINTIN, SNOWY and HADDOCK look for SAKHARINE and his men. The CROWDED STREETS are full of ARABS and BERBERS, many w HOODS and SCARFS covering their FACES. TWO MYSTERIOUS HOODED FIGURES come out and follow them.
ANGLE ON: HADDOCK and TINTIN walking through a crowded MARKETPLACE.
It’s no good. They could be anywhere! CLOSE ON: TINTIN whispers to HADDOCK.
(whisper) Captain - don't look now, but we’re being followed. CLOSE ON: HADDOCK casually glances behind him.
(softly) Ah, so we are. ANGLE ON: TINTIN and HADDOCK head toward the PALACE. The two MYSTERIOUS ROBED FIGURES come out of the shadows and follow them into a narrow alley.

ANGLE ON: Following the TWO HOODED FIGURES... TINTIN and HADDOCK'S FEET suddenly stick out from a DOORWAY, trippin them up! One sprawls onto the GROUND, causing the next to topple o as well! TINTIN steps forward, FISTS CLENCHED!
What do you want? Why are you following us?

Who are you working for? HADDOCK jumps on them, grabbing them and smashing them in the ground. ANGLE ON: The THOM(P)SONS look up in confusion! Their hoo fall away to reveal the BOWLER HATS on their heads! TINTIN steps in and pulls HADDOCK off them.
Captain, stop! Stop! Thompson! And ...Thomson! TINTIN helps the THOM(P}SONS stagger to their feet.
Not so loud
We’re in disguise.
So I see - you got the message I sent from the ship?
Yes, well, bit of a long story, that.
The upshot is - we caught the thief, retrieved your wallet, and then hopped on the next plane to Bagghar.
Yes, that pocket picker has picked his last pocket. With a flourish, THOMPSON produces TINTIN’S WALLET. THOMPSON {CONT’D) Bon‘t worry, he didn’t take any money.
(tense) It's not the money I'm worried about. CLOSE ON: TINTIN walks and turns away. He hurriedly fishe into his WALLET and produces the neatly folded SCROLL!
The odds are even! Now to find the next two scrolls.
TINTIN’s deep in THOUGHT ... He puts his WALLET and the SCROLL away. ANGLE ON: TINTIN slowly lifts his gaze to the OPERA BANNE which hangs across the square.
(quiet realization) The Milanese Nightingale. (MORE)

(in a soft voice) That‘s hia eecret weapon?! ANGLE ON: Tilting down from BIANCA CASTAPIORE'S PORTRAIT the slogn written below: The world-famous “Milanese Nightingale”! TINTIN, the THOM(P)SONS and HADDOCK stare a the banner.
Ahh! What a dish.

ANGLE ON: PAPARAZ2I snapping ... REPORTERS shouting over other ... BAGGHAR residents yelling for autographs. CLOSE ON: BIANCA CASTAFIORE ia all smilee and poses. She’ the very model of bejewelled OPERA STAR. BIANCA CASTAPIORE titters, delightedly. Her laugh rises t soprano trill. ANGLE ON: BEN SALAAD stands before her. He BOWS and KISSE her hand.
Enchanted, Signora. Bienvenuto! Welcome! We are blessed with your presence.

Yes, indeed Signore Salad. (waving to the crowd) What charming peasants! (turning back to SALAAD) May I introduce my escort, Monsieur Shuggair Addeitiff! ANGLE ON: From behind BIANCA CASTAFIORE steps SAKHARINE!! is dressed in a tuxedo. BIANCA theatrically rests her han his arm.
He‘’s been very... passionate in his support of this concert. It’s my first visit to the third world.
Please forgive me, I Must escort madame to her dreasing room, Excuse ust
SAKHARINE guides BIANCA CASTAFIORE away from BEN SALAAD. SALAAD and his SECRETARY applaud as she goes.
Bravo!
Bravo!
Bravo!
Bravo!
Bravo!
After you. His eyes flicking to the UNICORN MODEL as he goes past it ANGLE ON: NEV-R-BREAK BULLET PROOF GLASS logo on the disp containing the THIRD MODEL UNICORN.
As TINTIN and HADDOCK stand at the entrance of the palace GUESTS arrive for the opera. PALACE GUARDS watch TINTIN; makes a decision. He takes out his WALLET, whispers.
Here, I want you to look after this. What are you doing? TINTIN hands the SECOND SCROLL to a surprised HADDOCK.
Me?
Yes.
Are, you sure?
If I’m caught, I don't want them to find this on me. Just keep it hidden. HADDOCK gets down on one knee.
I will guard this with my life!
Get up, get up! The camera cranes up to reveal the whole of BEN SALAAD‘'S PALACE.

OPERA-GOERS take their seats as the ORCHESTRA plays. BEN SALAAD sits front and center. A stir of excitement... BEN SALAAD sits forward eagerly! ANGLE ON: CASTAFIORE enters with great fanfare. HADDOCK nudges TINTIN, excited.

It’s her! Through his opera glasses, TINTIN notices the NEV-R BREAK LOGO on the UNICORN DISPLAY CASE. She steps to the front of the stage and opens her mouth . LAUNCHING with great vigor into a well-known aria. CLOSE ON: HADDOCK as a look of horror crosses his face.
Blistering barnacles, what's that noise! My ears - they're bleeding!
No, they're not! HADDOCK hits his head against the chair. SNOWY begins to whine.
Shut up, Snowy! CLOSE ON: CASTAFIORE's hitting high notes, her bosom heav

Oh, Columbus! It's every man for himself! HADDOCK suddenly stands pushing past annoyed THEATRE PATR  ol. HADDOCK (CONT‘D) Make way, make way! Medical emergency! HADDOCK staggers for the exit, hands blocking his ears! HADDOCK reaches the table with the drinks, he grabs the tablecloth and yanks it off. The bottles and glasses don’ move, HADDOCK puts the tablecloth around his head, like Lawrence of Arabia.
ANGLE ON: HADDOCK hurries into the calm of the lobby. CASTAFIORE's somewhat muted voice can still be heard. ANGLE ON: HADDOCK takes out a BOTTLE from his jacket.
Ah ha! The SECOND SCROLL flutters out... CLOSE ON: HADDOCK’s hand trying not to loose it. HADDOCK stares at the SCROLL, folding it tightly.
That was close! He decidea to put the alcohol bottle down. He starts to w away... A HAND GRABS THE BOTTLE. As HADDOCK walka forward, ALLAN steps in front of him!
(chilling) Hello, Captain. HADDOCK looks at him, shocked!
Youl WHACK! ALLAN brings the BOTTLE of ALCOHOL crashing down o

INT. SALAAD PALACE THEATER — DAY The GUARD behind TINTIN moves closer.  92. ANGLE ON: TINTIN sees movement in the upper balcony... a FIGURE sits back in his SEAT, hidden from view. CASTAFIORE’s reflection appears on his glasses. The FALCO lands on his ARM. ANGLE ON: TINTIN borrows a pair of OPERA GLASSES lying on SEAT nearby. He quickly scans for the half-hidden figure the balcony. TINTIN POV: A brief glimpse of the FIGURE - it is the SILHOUETTE of SAKHARINE! CLOSE ON: CASTAFIORE’S FACE straining as her NOTES lift HIGHER and HIGHER!
CLOSE ON: TINTIN, as dawning realization crosses his face
Oh, no. TINTIN stands and turns to the BALCONY.
Sakharine! CLOSE ON: CASTAFIORE continues SINGING to EAR SPLITTING NOTES, eyes squeezed TIGHT! CRASH! GLASSES and CHAMPAGNE SHATTER! BEN SALAAD’s GLASSE

SAKHARINE leans into the light and reveals his SMILE. BIANCA’S VOICE SOARS HIGHER! ANGLE ON: The UNICORN MODEL. Its GLASS CASE begins breaki long SPIDERY CRACKS racing across the SURFACE, as if unde HUGE PRESSURE. ANGLE ON: TINTIN suddenly stands - SMASH!! A GLASS CHANDELIER shatters into TINY PIECES! CASTAFIORE, still singing, turns towards the BALCONY - raising her arm in a DRAMATIC GESTURE. CLOSE ON: CASTAFIORE summons a deep breath, OPENS HER MOU and hits B FLAT over HIGH C!  93. The GLASS UNICORN CASE SHATTERS with EXPLOSIVE FORCE! Bro GLASS flies in all directions. ANGLE ON: BEN SALAAD reacts to the SHATTERING CASE! SAKHARINE calmly launches his FALCON. TINTIN (CONT’D) (yelling) The falcon! Snowy, after it! At that moment HADDOCK bursts into the THEATRE, waving hi arms around madly!
(yelling) Tintin!
(from the balcony) Those two! They're here to steal your ship! BEN SALAAD leaps to his feet, waving his arms at HADDOCK, screaming ORDERS!
No, no, no, no, no, we're not!
Arrest him! The ugly one!
No wait!
(pointing to himself) Me?

Yes! Thief! Arrest him! BEN SALAAD’S SOLDIERS race towards HADDOCK. CASTAFIORE looks around at the sudden mayhem confused by the PANIC! HADDOCK is immediately pounced on by SEVERAL PALACE GUARD HADDOCK ROARS, FISTS FLYING, sending GUARDS toppling in a directions.
C’est un voleur!

TINTIN hurries towards HADDOCK, keeping his EYES on SAKHA in the BALCONY ... The PALCON soars down over the HEADS of the THEATER-GOERS flying towards the shattered UNICORN CASE. ANGLE ON: the FALCON swoops low, landing on the UNICORN MODEL... he picks it up in hia talons and flies into the The UNICORN falls. The UNICORN MODEL topples onto the FLOOR. The MAST BREAKS

text: The FALCON swoops down to pick it up. It's a race between SNOWY AND THE FALCON. The FALCON snatches up the METAL CYLINDER in hia BEAK, an instantly TAKES TO THE AIR, just avoiding the snapping JA of SNOWy who has raced towards him! TINTIN watches helplessly as the FALCON flies back to SAKHARINE, who catches him, and immediately DISAPPEARS. B SALAAD SCREAMS order in Prench. TINTIN manages to fight his way through to HADDOCK. MORE PALACE GUARDS close in on TINTIN and HADDOCK! BEN SA is SHOUTING ANGRY ORDERS, completely missing SAKHARINE an the PALCON. TINTIN and HADDOCK manage to eacape.
ANGLE ON: TINTIN and HADDOCK race out of the THEATER!
Captain, Sakharine’s got the scroll!
It's worse than that!
(horrified) What do you mean?
They took your scroll Tintin - it's gone!  9. TINTIN skids to a HALT... approaching SHOUTS...
How?! What happened?
It was Allan, he, he knobbled me in the, in the garden. There was a bottle of alcohol... TINTIN cuts him off, disappointment written all over his face.
There always is.
No, no. No, not like that - HADDOCK puts his hands on TINTIN’s shoulders.

I can smell it on you. TINTIN pushes HADDOCK's hands off, and heads out. EXT. BELOW DAM, BAGGHAR STREETS — DAY ANGLE ON: SAKHARINE pulls out the THREE SCROLLS from his JACKET POCKET - it is the first time we have seen all thr together. SAKHARINE’S FALCON sits on the corner of the windshield of the JEEP! SAKHARINE smiles smugly drops the THREE SCROLLS into the LEATHER WALLET.
Hurry! Back to the boat!
TINTIN punches a GUARD, who falls to the GROUND.
ANGLE ON: HADDOCK desperately runs out of the palace
Tintin! HADDOCK joins TINTIN...  96.
Where are you going?
I'm going after Sakharine!
By yourself?

Yes. Come on, Snowy. HADDOCK considers his options. He turns back and grabs the GUARD’S WEAPON: a ROCKET LAUNCHER, from the ground. A GUARD is starting to stand up, as HADDOCK swings the LAUNCHER over his shoulder and turns, he knocks out the G back to the ground. HADDOCK walks over to the motorcycle, TINTIN kicks in the engine. BEN SALAAD runs out of the palace.

Get them, get them! ANGLE ON: TINTIN rockets across the BRIDGE, riding a MOTORCYCLE, with HADDOCK and SNOWY in a SIDECAR. EXT. BELOW DAM, BAGGHAR STREETS — DAY TINTIN’s reflection is in the rearview mirror of the JEEP TOM looks back. ANGLE ON: SAKHARINE glances behind him - his face sets in HARD MASK when he sees TINTIN.

Loge them! Get him off our tail! ANGLE ON: ALLAN begins firing on the MOTORCYCLE. SNOWY hides in the SIDECAR from the gunfire. HADDOCK swings the ROCKET LAUNCHER onto his SHOULDER ... HADDOCK squeezes the TRIGGER... BOOM! The ROCKET LAUNCHER fires backward - straight into the DAM CONTROL STATION! ANGLE ON: HADDOCK looks back, trying to SPOT where the RO HIT... he can sees A CLOUD OF SMOKE rising.  97.
Did you hit anything?
Oh, dear, HADDOCK throws down the ROCKET LAUNCHER. The WALL of the DAM bursts with a THUNDEROUS BOOM! ANGLE ON: TINTIN and HADDOCK desperately attempt to outru the wall of mud in the motorcycle!
ANGLE ON: SAKHARINE as he watches the DELUGE behind TINTI and HADDOCK.

Faster, you idiot, faster! TINTIN skillfully navigates the MOTORCYCLE, as TOM desperately steers the JEEP down flooded streets. ANGLE ON: SAKHARINE looking behind them ... SAKHARINE POV: a TORRENT of MUD is BEARING DOWN on them! TINTIN'S MOTORCYCLE is getting closer! TINTIN and HADDOCK drive past on motorbike with sidecar . SNOWY LEAPS into the JEEP and tries to grabs the SCROLLS. SAKHARINE tries to keep them from SNOWY, only to have the SCROLLS grabbed by TINTIN. SNOWY JUMPS BACK TO THE MOTORCYCLE.
Devil!
I’1l have those, thank you!

Come on, Snowy! Come on! Incoming falcon at 4 o'clock! SAKHARINE's FALCON flies after TINTIN and HADDOCK... he swoops down! The MUDSLIDE slams into the city BUILDINGS, destroying everything in its path.  98. A TANK bursts through the WALL behind them and HADDOCK is banged on the head by the BARREL. HADDOCK’S COAT is snagg by the TANK CANNON and he is lifted from the SIDECAR.
Tintin, faster! The scrolls slip from TINTIN'’s hand - HADDOCK grabs two.
The scrolls!
Got one! Two! SNOWY grabs the SCROLL before it flutters away.
And three! The MOTORCYCLE breaks in two, and TINTIN and SNOWY sail o in different directions!

Snowy! HADDOCK hangs from BARREL of TANK... the TANK careens and slides all over the road, smashing HADDOCK from one wall another. HADDOCK hangs precariously over the edge of a drop... HADDOCK falls through lines of washing... HADDOCK loses another SCROLL which flutters up into the a The SCROLL flutters in the air, HADDOCK tries to grab it.

Oh, no - oh no! Not again! Come here, my beauty! The FALCON swoops in and snatches the SCROLL... HADDOCK g chase, cursing as he goes! HADDOCK (CONT’D) Ten thousand thundering typhoons! Come here, you pilfering parakeet! TINTIN collects HADDOCK on the front of his MOTORBIKE.
Captain, the bird - grab it!

SNOWY rides atop the MUDSLIDE and manages to capture the FALCON, pinning him down with the SCROLL still in his BEA They RACE alongside TINTIN and HADDOCK. TINTIN (CONT’D) Nice work, Snowy - don‘t let him go! HADDOCK launces himself at the FALCON ... he manages to u SNOWY and the BIRD - they fly through the air into a BUILDING, as SNOWY hangs on by his TEETH to the SCROLL th FALCON holds in hia TALONS! HADDOCK ends up inaide the building ... he swirls around around as the MUD RISES HIGHER ..-
Hang on, Snowy! Snowy, I’m coming! HADDOCK grabs SNOWY. Winded, SNOWY lets go of the SCROLL. The FALCON snatches the SCROLL ... SAKHARINE arrives in the JEEP ...
There he is! There he is, stop! Stop!! He raises his arm to the bird. SAKHARINE (CONT‘D) That's right. That’s right, come to daddy! Come to daddy ... TINTIN intercepts the FALCON!
Got you!
No, wait! He grabs the bird and manages to get two of the SCROLLS before the FALCON escapes!
No!! As SAKHARINE pursues TINTIN, HADDOCK bears down on SAKHAR and his HENCHMEN.
Come on, quickly! Quickly!
Geronimo! HADDOCK lands on the JEEP!
You double-dealing, pilfering parasites!

Keep your eye on the boy! HADDOCK thumps ALLAN, ALLAN tries to fight back. TINTIN chases the FALCON through the collapsing BUILDING nearly manages to capture it after it becomes entangled i LOOM. The FALCON breaks free and the chase continues!

Excuse me! Pardon me! Sorry! The MOTORCYCLE is smashed on a bridge, and TINTIN uses th HANDLEBARS to ride ELECTRICAL WIRES like a ZIPLINE. He ru along the WALLS of BUILDINGS, SMASHES into POLES and ride LANTERN after the FALCON, the THREADS that still entangle bird just beyond his grasp! Juet as the FALCON loses TINTIN, he jumps from a BALCONY grabs the FALCON.
Got you!
There he is! TIME SLOWS as TINTIN slowly aligns the SCROLLS, still loc in the TALONS of the FALCON. The mysterious SYMBOLS slowl become NUMBERS.
The scrolls are lining up. These are hidden numbers. SAKHARINE observes TINTIN from nearby.
What does it say? TINTIN’s moment of discovery is interrupted by SAKHARINE.
I wouldn’t do that if I were you!  TOM and ALLAN hold HADDOCK over the edge of a nearby BUILDING.
Let the bird go. What do you value more, those scrolls or Haddock's life?
Agh! Don’t listen to him! You'll never get away with this, you sour— faced sassonack!
I will kill him! TINTIN refusea to release the FALCON.
Bon't worry about me, Tintin, I’m fine!
Let the bird go now or this man dies! ALLAN and TOM prepare to throw HADDOCK into the water.
No, wait!
(to SAKHARINE) You two-timing troglodyte! You simpering son of a po~face profiteer.
Perhaps we should put it to the test. Here's mud in your eye! ALLAN and TOM throw HADDOCK into the MUD!
Fat head! TINTIN releases the FALCON and dives in after him! The FA flies to SAKHARINE’S ARM.  102.
WIDE ON: The TANK finishes dragging the HOTEL BAGGHAR to harbor before falling into the water. THOMPSON and THOMSO emerge on the balcony.
We're saved!
I love the beach.
You gaid you wanted a holiday!
Quite. The MANAGER of the HOTEL comes out and places a STARFISH his SIGN to add a fourth star to the hotel’s three. ANGLE ON: The KARABOUDJAN STEAMS AWAY from the BAY. HADDO is watching it LEAVE.
(furious outrage) Nobody takea my ship! ANGLE ON: HADDOCK turns to TINTIN for support, but finds TINTIN just sitting, looking defeated.
They've already taken it.
Nobody takes my ship twice!
(energized) We'll show them, eh, won't we, Tintin? Alright then - what’s the plan?
There is no plan.
Of course there's a plan - you always gotta have a plan.
Not this time.  103.
HADDOCK looks at TINTIN expectantly.
Sakharine has the scrolls. They‘1l lead him to the treasure... it could be anywhere in the world. We'll never see him again. TINTIN shakes his head. TINTIN (CONT’D) It’s over.
I thought you were an optimist!
Well, you were wrong, weren‘t you? I'ma realist.
That’s just another name for a quitter.
You can call me what you like. Don’t you get it? We failed.

Failed? There are plenty of others willing to call you a failure, a fool, a loser, a hopeless souse! But don’t you ever say it of yourself! HADDOCK pokes TINTIN in the chest and he falls back into chair. HADDOCK looks at TINTIN a beat.

You send out the wrong signal, that is what people pick up. Do you understand? You care about something, you fight for it. You hit a wall, you push through it. There's something you need to know about failure, Tintin... HADDOCK turns and walks away from TINTIN. TINTIN looks up HADDOCK. HADDOCK turns and looks at the KARABOUDJAN leavi HADDOCK (CONT’D) You can never let it defeat you.  104. TINTIN plays back what he hae just heard. He looks up. An suddenly we know we've reached a TURNING POINT.
What did you just say?
You hit a wall, you push through it?
No, no, no, you said something about sending out a signal! TINTIN slaps one hand with the other.
(explaining) Of course! Captain, I sent a radio message from the Karaboudjan. I know what radio frequency they‘re transmitting on.
Well, how does that help us?

All we have to do is send that information to Interpol. They can track the signals and figure out which way they’re headed. The THOM(P)SONS appear in the distance, walking along the beach towards them.
(delighted) Here comes Interpol now.
Tintin!
Any port they enter, we'll know at once. HADDOCK’S eyes sweep round the harbour and settle on the SEAPLANE that is moored there.
We can get there first!

WIDE ON: A BUSY EUROPEAN DOCKLAND. CRANES stand like skel DINOSAURS, RAILWAY TRACKS run up the length of WHARFS, wh many SHIPS are MOORED. ANGLE ON: The KARABOUDJAN pulls into DOCK. SAKHARINE comes STRIDING down the GANGWAY, TOM and ALLAN behind him. STANDING next to a stately BENTLEY CAR, waiting for them, NESTOR in a CHAUFFEUR’S UNIFORM.
What are we doing here, boss? I don't get it. We’re right back where we started.
You’re to speak of this to no one. Keep your mouths shut.
Don’t worry. As long as we get our share.
Oh, you'll get your share. Just guard the ship. SAKHARINE brandishes the three SCROLLS.
But where are you going? (beat) Where's the filthy moulah? SAKHARINE exchanges a glance with ALLAN. He understands ALLAN'S worry. SAKHARINE walks toward his waiting CAR, where NESTOR is standing.
Good evening, sir. I trust you had a successful trip abroad?
(rudely) Do I pay you to talk to me?

(muttering under his breath) You don’t pay me at all. ANGLE ON: SAKHARINE slides into the CAR. SUDDENLY, CHAINS lift on either side of the CAR! Before SAKHARINE can react, the car starts rising into th air! WIDE ON: The CAR is being lifted by one of the huge WHARF
What the blazes? Nestor, Nestor! ALLAN and TOM come out of the SHIP with their GUNS drawn. They look up and see the CAR moving TOWARD TEE CRANE! SAKHARINE (CONT’D)

ALLAN and TOM just stand and watch. ANGLE ON: HADDOCK in the CAB of the CRANE, pulling LEVERS HADDOCK drives the CRANE forward and SWING THE CAR to the of the ROOF of a BUILDING, where TINTIN stands with the THOM(P)SON TWINS.
Caught him like a rat in a trap!
Congratulations, gentlemen. He's all yours.
Yes! We also have an arrest warrant issued by both Interpol and the FBI.
Your friend who got shot...
Barnaby! ?  107.
One of their agents. Hot on Sakharine‘s trail from the start.

It still doesn’t make any sense. He has the key to the treasure of the Unicorn, which is sitting somewhere on the ocean floor. Why would he come back home? ANGLE ON: The CAR swings over and lands in front of the waiting group; they approach the CAR. ANGLE ON: HADDOCK laughs from his CRANE as they approach. THOMPSON steps forward and pulls open the back door... th back is EMPTY!
Right. THOMPSON (CONT‘D) THOMSON Sakharine? Sakharine? SILENCE. SAKHARINE sits up in the driver seat.

That's Mr. Sakharine to you! SAKHARINE pulls a GUN and keeps them at gunpoint; the oth slowly back away. SAKHARINE (CONT’D) Hold it! ANGLE ON: HADDOCK sees ALLAN'S REFLECTION in the broken windshield of the crane. ALLAN enters with a GUN in HAND; HADDOCK quickly turns th CRANE, throwing ALLAN off balance. The GUN goes off, the BULLET shattering a WINDOW. HADDOCK tries to WRESTLE IT F HIS GRIP. The CRANE ARM swings wildly, and TINTIN and the THOM(P)SO leap for their lives as SAKHARINE’S CAR swings across the ROOF, slams into a WALL and is lifted INTO THE AIR. SAKHARINE (CONT’D) What's going... ?  108. HADDOCK and ALLAN in the CRANE CAB. ALLAN pushes HADDOCK the SIDE DOOR, and he hangs precariously from a RAILING. ALLAN runs to the controls and raises the CRANE, lifting SAKHARHINE and the CAR into the air.
Allan! Allan! Get me down, get me down, man! ANGLE ON: SAKHARINE in the CAR as it is SWUNG AWAY from t BUILDING on the PALLET.

Not that way! Not that way, you fool, the other way! HADDOCK sneaks in behind ALLAN, throws him from the ROOM, ALLAN lands in the BED of a PASSING TRUCK. He takes a sea the CRANE CONTROLS. SAKHARINE jumpa out of the CAR and into the cab of SECOND CRANE. ANGLE ON: SAKHARINE takes a seat in the SECOND CRANE. He struggles with the CONTROLS.

SAKHARINE and HADDOCK jump into action, and the CRANES approach each other and COLLIDE! HADDOCK and SAKHARINE duel, as the MASSIVE METAL ARMS of CRANES violently SLAM into each other. TINTIN and the THOM(P)SONS dive to safety as SAKHARINE’S CRANE ARM swing just over their heads. SAKHARINE then uses the arm to thr PALETTE of CEMENT BAGS into HADDOCK’S CAB.

HADDOCK fights to clear the CAB of the DUST and DEBRIS; t ARM of SAKHARINE’S CRANE crashes into the front window of CAB. ANGLE ON: A POLICE CAR is split in two by a CRANE. HADDOCK slams his CRANE ARM onto the SAKHARINE'S CABIN, ripping away the ROOF!

Close, but no cigar!  109. SAKHARINE knocks out the SUPPORTS of HADDOCK’S CRANE with PALETTE of BOXES. HADDOCK hits his head on the CABIN ROOF BOXES and CRATES rain down on TINTIN, SNOWY and the TWINS TOM runs at them with a GUN, but is trapped as several TI land on him. A group of THUGS rush to TOM’S aid, but SNOW opens a CRATE of CANS that trip them up! HADDOCK charges with his CRANE; SAKHARINE and HADDOCK are face to face.
(deadly) Red Rackham!
That’s right, my ancestor. Just as Sir Francis was yours.
(grim) Unfinished business.

I‘m glad you know the truth, Haddock. Until you could remember, killing you wouldn't have been this much fun! SAKHARINE’S CRANE slides backward, the ARM SWINGS WILDLY knocks HADDOCK'S CRANE over! ANGLE ON: TINTIN watches as HADDOCK’S CRANE falls. HADDOCK’S CRANE lands on the DECK of the KARABOUDJAN; he tumbles out of the cabin with other debris from the CRANE SAKHARINE walks down the ARM of the CRANE toward HADDOCK.
Who gave you permission to board my ship?!

I don't need it. SAKHARINE pulls a SWORD from his CANE. SAKHARINE (CONT‘’D) I’ve never needed it. As HADDOCK stands, he grabs a METAL LEVER off the GROUND.  110. ANGLE ON: HADDOCK and SAKHARINE duel, just like their ANCESTORS did... and just as RED RACKHAM did, SAKHARINE fights DIRTY. CLANG! The METAL of the SWORD meets the STEEL of the LEVE SAKHARINE kicks HADDOCK to the ground. As HADDOCK tries t get up, SAKHARINE grabs a FISHNET and throws it at HADDOC it wraps around his neck.
